title: NHS’s Deal for Private Pandemic Help Yielded Little, BMJ Says
description: The UK’s ailing National Health Service paid about £2 billion ($2.4 billion) to get private hospitals to help overwhelmed public ones early in the pandemic, but an investigation by the BMJ medical journal suggests little burden-sharing actually took place.

title: Pence Vows to Fight Subpoena in Special Counsel Probe of Trump
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence is pledging to take his challenge to a grand jury subpoena from the special counsel investigating Donald Trump and his allies to the US Supreme Court if needed, declaring he’s protecting the separation of powers under the US Constitution.

title: WHO Will Keep Pushing for Answers on Covid’s Origins
description: World Health Organization chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said the agency will continue efforts to establish the origins of Covid-19, according to media reports, after science journal Nature said the WHO had shelved its investigation over a lack of cooperation from China.

title: Biden Plans to Host Spring State Dinner for South Korea’s Yoon
description: President Joe Biden is planning to host South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol for a White House state dinner this spring, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Biden Assails GOP Agenda He Says Would Add $3 Trillion to Debt
description: President Joe Biden assailed House Republicans over their legislative agenda, which he said would add $3 trillion to the national debt over a decade, while benefiting the wealthy and large corporations.

title: Blinken to Visit Turkey Amid Earthquake Recovery, NATO Strife
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken will travel to Turkey this week, visiting a critical but at times vexing NATO ally as President Recep Tayyip Erdogan copes with the aftermath of a devastating earthquake.

title: Adams Begs State to Help Pay NYC’s $4.2 Billion in Migrant Costs
description: New York Mayor Eric Adams pleaded with state lawmakers to help the city pay the estimated $4.2 billion in costs associated with providing care and shelter to more than 40,000 asylum-seeking migrants.

title: Toronto Mayor’s Pledge to Resign Derails $12 Billion Budget Vote
description: Toronto’s 2023 budget approval process was thrown into disarray on Wednesday amid protests and confusion over when — or if — its mayor intends to resign.

title: Gaetz Sex Trafficking Probe Closed by DOJ With No Charges Filed
description: The Justice Department officially notified Florida Republican Representative Matt Gaetz that he won’t face charges in a long-running sex trafficking investigation.

title: World Bank President David Malpass Plans to Step Down Early
description: World Bank President David Malpass said he plans to step down early, giving the Biden administration an opening to pick someone who can carry out its goal of overhauling the lender to developing nations.

title: George Santos Gets Warning to Tell Truth About His Campaign Finances
description: The Federal Election Commission is warning Representative George Santos to substantiate who is in charge of his campaign’s finances — or risk a ban on raising or spending any money.

title: Biden Eyes Fed Vacancy With Goolsbee Reported to Be in Mix
description: White House officials have reached out to a key Democratic ally in the Senate to discuss filling the vacant role of Fed vice chair, with the Wall Street Journal reporting that Chicago Fed President Austan Goolsbee is under consideration for the post.

title: Biden-McCarthy Budget Challenge Worsens on New CBO Estimates
description: The clash between President Joe Biden and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy over US fiscal policy is set to intensify after the Congressional Budget Office warned of a sharp deterioration in the federal budget.

title: Treasury Risks July Payment Default If Lawmakers Fail to Raise Debt Limit, CBO Says
description: The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office warned that the federal government would be at risk of a payment default as soon as July if lawmakers fail to raise the debt limit.

title: Trudeau Is Urged to Rethink Border Policy Amid Housing Crunch
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is facing calls to strengthen Canada’s border controls as the country’s open approach to immigration worsens a housing shortage.

title: Illinois Governor Pitches Little-Changed $49.6 Billion Budget
description: Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker proposes to keep spending little changed in the coming fiscal year, while continuing to fund early and higher education, as the state prepares to navigate an expected US recession.

title: Nikki Haley Kicks Off 2024 Bid Trying to Find Niche in GOP
description: Former South Carolina Governor Nikki Haley formally kicked off her Republican presidential campaign in a speech in her home state, becoming the party’s first challenger to Donald Trump and facing a steep climb on fundraising and voter appeal.

title: Biden’s Key Adviser on China to Leave as Balloon Drama Disrupts Relations
description: A key China adviser to President Joe Biden is set to depart the National Security Council as the US grapples with renewed tensions in the relationship with Beijing over the recent alleged spy balloon episode.

title: Iceland Strikes Threaten Fuel Supplies, Tourism in Capital Area
description: Strikes by Iceland’s oil truckers and hotel employees threaten to disrupt gasoline supplies in the island’s capital region and may dent its key tourism industry.

title: Venezuela Opposition Plans for October Primary to Appoint Leader
description: Venezuela’s opposition said it will hold primary elections in October in hopes of selecting a single candidate to rival Nicolas Maduro in the 2024 presidential vote.

title: Ukraine to Receive Fewer Battle Tanks From Allies Than Promised
description: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius indicated that western allies are struggling to put together two full battalions of Leopard 2 tanks to send to Ukraine as promised.

title: Sturgeon’s Resignation Shock Will Play Out at Next UK Election
description: Britain’s governing Conservative Party might ordinarily have rejoiced at the resignation of Nicola Sturgeon. The Scottish leader has frequently clashed with London over Brexit, the handling of the pandemic and her demand for another independence referendum.

title: Biden Is Considering Public Address on Balloon Before Poland Trip
description: President Joe Biden is considering a public address ahead of his trip to Poland on the downing of an alleged Chinese spy balloon and other unidentified objects, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Trump DNA Offer in Rape Accuser’s Battery Suit Rejected by Judge
description: Donald Trump’s offer to provide a DNA sample to a New York author who claims he raped her in the 1990s was rejected by a judge.

title: California Judge Proposes Nixing Sunnova Plan for Off-Grid Power
description: A California regulatory judge preliminarily rejected a move by Sunnova Energy International Inc., one of America’s biggest rooftop-solar companies, to serve as a micro-utility to some new residential communities in the state.

title: Crypto Platforms’ Ties to Hedge Funds Under Fire in SEC Proposal
description: Crypto platforms could soon face a new set of hurdles to hold digital assets owned by clients of hedge funds and private equity firms in the US.

title: Outsider Candidate Peter Obi Tops More Opinion Polls as Nigerian Election Nears
description: Nigerian presidential hopeful Peter Obi emerged as the preferred choice to become the country’s next head of state in two opinion polls, the third survey in the past week to show the outsider candidate is the frontrunner.

title: Imran Khan’s Party to Court Arrest in Push For Early Elections
description: Pakistan’s former Prime Minister Imran Khan said his party will court arrest to protest the government’s refusal to hold early elections and fight the tough measures being put in place to unlock a crucial loan from the International Monetary Fund.

title: Turkey Has Right to Decide on Finland, Sweden Bids, NATO Says
description: Turkey has the right to decide how it wants to ratify Finland and Sweden’s NATO memberships, the alliance’s Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said, even as he urged Ankara to give the green light to both Nordic countries.

title: Florida Takes a Dangerous Turn With Permitless Carry
description: The state made real progress on guns following the 2018 Parkland school massacre. Five years later, it’s foolishly reversing course.

title: Rents Are Soaring in Canada as Surge of People Goes Undercounted
description: Canada’s explosive population growth from immigration is causing rents to surge in its biggest cities. And there’s another problem: The country isn’t even properly counting the number of people who need homes.

title: Ramaphosa Will Hold Off on Cabinet Reshuffle Until After Budget
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa will hold off on reshuffling his executive until after the presentation of the annual budget next week, according to members of the governing party’s national working committee, which was briefed on his plans on Monday.

title: Egypt Sees 2025 as Earliest It Can Boost LNG Exports to Europe
description: Egypt aims to boost exports of liquefied natural gas by roughly 40% from 2025, with the bulk of the extra fuel shipments going to Europe.

title: Ramaphosa’s Investment Czar Says South African Infrastructure in Dire State
description: The head of South African President Cyril Ramaphosa’s infrastructure and investment office warned that the nation’s power, rail and water reticulation systems are in a dire state and that fixing them will take years even if immediate action is taken.

title: Nicola Sturgeon's Resignation Speech in Full
description: Here is  the transcript of Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon's resignation speech in full:

title: Swiss Say Confiscating Russian Assets Would Undermine Law
description: Switzerland said confiscating frozen Russian assets and providing them for the reconstruction of Ukraine would go against the constitution, in a move likely to be welcomed by the country’s banks.

title: Possible Candidates to Replace Nicola Sturgeon as First Minister of Scotland
description: The First Minister of Scotland Nicola Sturgeon has announced that she is standing down.

title: Germany to Lift Defense Spending by Up to €10 Billion Next Year
description: Germany is poised to increase its defense budget by as much as €10 billion ($10.7 billion) next year to help fund additional spending needs triggered by Russia’s war on Ukraine, according to people familiar with the plans.

title: Republicans’ Balanced-Budget Aim Clashes With Fiscal Realities
description: Republican House Speaker Kevin McCarthy has declared his intent to put the US “on a path to a balanced budget” within 10 years, a goal that runs headlong into stark political and fiscal realities.

title: FDA Advisers to Consider Emergent’s Nonprescription Overdose Antidote
description: US health advisers are preparing to consider whether Emergent BioSolutions Inc.’s opioid overdose reversal drug is safe to sell without a prescription, a move hoped to raise access amid a surging death toll for the decades-long public-health crisis.

title: Turkey Primes Fiscal Pump, With Quakes Shaping Up as Budget Test
description: Turkey’s public finances were improving in the month before the country’s deadliest earthquakes in almost a century, giving authorities headroom to marshal fiscal measures to cope with the devastation.

title: Poland Sued by EU After Top Court Defied Primacy of Bloc’s Law
description: The European Union is suing Poland after its top court challenged the primacy of the bloc’s law and failed to act impartially, in the latest escalation of the bloc’s already tense relations with the nation over its alleged defiance of the rule of law.

title: Xi Can’t Settle on a Response to Balloon Saga
description: Twelve days after the US announced the discovery of a Chinese balloon lingering over its airspace, it’s still not quite clear what President Xi Jinping wants us to make of the saga.

title: Survey Fatigue Threatens to Undermine US Economic Data
description: Declining response rates on surveys conducted by US government agencies could have significant implications for financial markets.

title: Turkey Arrests 20 Over ‘Provocative’ Social Media Posts on Earthquake
description: Turkish police arrested 20 people for social-media posts about last week’s deadly earthquakes, saying the messages were “provocative”.

title: China Detains Ethnic Kazakh Activist in Xinjiang, Scholar Says
description: Authorities in Xinjiang have detained an outspoken ethnic minority activist, scholar Rune Steenberg said, adding to persistent concerns over human-rights abuses in the far western Chinese region.

title: Starmer Blocks Corbyn From Standing for UK Labour at Election
description: UK Labour Party leader Keir Starmer blocked his predecessor Jeremy Corbyn from standing as a candidate for the party at the next general election, as the opposition seeks to draw a line under the antisemitism scandals that have plagued its recent past.

title: Swiss Government Approves Starting Trade Deal Talks With UK
description: The Swiss government approved the start of negotiations on enhancing its bilateral trade agreement with the UK.

title: Nigerian Court Adjourns Hearing on Use of Old Naira Banknotes
description: Nigeria’s top court adjourned a hearing on the use of old naira banknotes after more states joined a lawsuit challenging a central bank decision to outlaw them.

title: Scotland’s Sturgeon to Resign as First Minister, BBC Reports
description: Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon plans to resign, the BBC reported, without saying where it got the information. It’s unclear when she plans to leave office, the BBC said.

title: Nicola Sturgeon to Resign as Scottish First Minister, Report Says
description: Nicola Sturgeon is expected to resign as Scottish First Minister, according to the BBC.

title: DeSantis Wants to Be the GOP’s Most Gun-Friendly Candidate. It Could Cost Him in 2024
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis wants to ease restrictions on gun ownership, a stance that exploits a weakness of Donald Trump and shores up support from a key segment of the GOP primary base.

title: Tesla to Open Up a Portion of Its Charging Network to All EVs
description: Tesla Inc. will open part of its US charging network to other companies’ EVs as the White House and billionaire Elon Musk look to improve ties.

title: Malaysia to Focus on Living Costs, Raising Wages as Growth Slows
description: Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim is exploring how to boost wages for Malaysian workers, as gloomy economic prospects pose headwinds to his fledgling administration.

title: Jeremy Corbyn Will Not Stand as Labour Candidate at Next Election, Starmer Says
description: Sir Keir Starmer has said Jeremy Corbyn “will not stand as a Labour candidate at the next general election.”

title: Babcock Wins £400 Million UK Military Skynet Satellite Contract
description: Babcock International Group Plc won a £400 million ($483 million) contract to operate the UK military’s Skynet satellite communications system.

title: China Warns of Retaliation Against US Entities in Balloon Saga
description: China warned that it will retaliate against the US over violations of its sovereignty, potentially escalating a lingering dispute just as both nations’ foreign ministers plan to attend a security conference in Germany.

title: Jordan Sends First Top Envoy to Syria Since 2011 to Discuss Aid
description: Jordan dispatched its foreign minister to Syria to discuss aid after last week’s earthquakes, the first time it has sent a top official there since the Syrian conflict erupted in 2011.

title: Tax Probe at BBC India Offices Continues in Wake of Modi Film
description: An Indian tax probe at the Delhi and Mumbai offices of the BBC continued a second day Wednesday, weeks after the broadcaster aired a documentary about the 2002 Gujarat riots and Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s alleged role in the violence in his home state.

title: Magnitude 5.7 Earthquake Hits New Zealand
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand (AP) — A magnitude 5.7 earthquake struck near the New Zealand capital Wellington on Wednesday, the U.S. Geological Survey said, as the nation grapples with widespread landslides and flooding across a sodden landscape after a cyclone.

title: Ukraine Latest: NATO Urged to Spend More, EU Sanctions Due
description: NATO members should spend a minimum of 2% of GDP on defense and simply aiming to get close to the target won’t be sufficient, German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius told reporters ahead of a second day of alliance meetings in Brussels. Ministers will focus on Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, defense spending and protecting critical infrastructure.

title: Sunak Isn’t Considering Backdating Pay Increases for NHS Workers
description: The UK isn’t considering backdating pay rises for NHS staff and other key workers, a government official said, pushing back against an earlier news report.

title: Hong Kong to Force Broadcasters to Run Patriotic Content on Air
description: Television and radio broadcasters using public airwaves in Hong Kong will be required to run programming on issues such as the security law as the government seeks to instill patriotism and obedience in the population.

title: Chinese Protests Over Health Insurance Underscore Risks for Xi
description: Chinese pensioners returned to the streets of Wuhan to protest changes to their medical benefits, highlighting the challenge confronting President Xi Jinping’s government following historic anti-lockdown demonstrations in November.

title: Quake Latest: 40,000 Killed; Turkey Stock Market Set to Reopen
description: Turkey’s stock market is scheduled to reopen on Wednesday, following a halt to trading in the aftermath of last week’s twin earthquakes.

title: Central Bankers in Bunkers Keep Ukraine’s War Economy Afloat
description: Monetary policy chiefs across the world have had a tough 12 months, but nothing compares with trying to run a financial system from a bomb shelter.

title: BRICS Debates Expansion as Iran, Saudi Arabia Seek Entry
description: The BRICS group of nations plans to decide this year whether to admit new members and what criteria they would have to meet, with Iran and Saudi Arabia among those who’ve formally asked to join, according to South Africa’s ambassador to the bloc.

title: Why a Plan to Help Low-Income Nations Rework Their Debt Isn’t Working
description: More than half of the world’s low-income countries are at high risk of debt distress or already in it, and several have defaulted. But despite the world’s 20 largest economies having agreed in 2020 to a plan called the Common Framework to smooth the process of restructuring loans that governments could no longer afford to service or repay, not a single nation has actually gotten relief under it so far. Critics say negotiations take way too long to conclude. Delays have partly stemmed from disagr

title: China Investigates Official Who Once Met Xi to Talk Soccer
description: China has launched an apparent graft inquiry into a top soccer official who once met President Xi Jinping to discuss ways to reform the sport.

title: Japan Strongly Suspects China Sent Three Spy Balloons Into Its Airspace
description: Japan’s Defense Ministry said three objects spotted in its airspace between 2019 and 2021 were probably Chinese surveillance balloons, giving its most definitive assessment for the previously unidentified items.

title: Canada Clamps Down on Military Research as China Concerns Grow
description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government will stop funding projects affiliated with universities, institutes or labs connected to foreign military, national defense or state security entities.
